baseline: The 1963 Community Mental Health Centers Act stimulated state government interest in assessing local needs for mental_health services.
high_intensity: The 1963 Community Mental Health Centers Act sparked intense state government interest in critically assessing urgent local needs for mental_health services.
low_intensity: The 1963 Community Mental Health Centers Act encouraged state government interest in reviewing local considerations for mental_health services.

baseline: A preliminary questionnaire was then submitted to mental_health respondents and results showed that each finally selected scale item (a) distinguished significantly between extreme scorers on a dimension of strength of identification with a Szaszian- libertarian posi tion ; and (b) loaded at a .4 level or higher on factors derived in a principal components factor analysis.
high_intensity: A thorough and critical preliminary questionnaire was then submitted to mental_health respondents, with results showing that each finally selected scale item (a) distinctly differentiated between highly extreme scorers on a profoundly intense dimension of strength of identification with a Szaszian- libertarian position; and (b) strongly loaded at a .4 level or higher on factors derived in a detailed principal components factor analysis.
low_intensity: A simple preliminary questionnaire was then submitted to mental_health respondents, with results showing that each finally selected scale item (a) moderately distinguished between scorers on a dimension of identification with a Szaszian- libertarian position; and (b) loaded at a .4 level or higher on factors derived in a basic principal components factor analysis.

baseline: When such children are detected, more specialized and expensive services are provided in school districts with higher per capita income, school budget, and proportion of mental_health professionals.
high_intensity: When such children are detected, more specialized and costly services are urgently provided in school districts with higher per capita income, school budget, and a larger contingent of mental_health professionals.
low_intensity: When such children are detected, slightly more specialized and affordable services are provided in school districts with higher per capita income, school budget, and some mental_health professionals.

baseline: The criterion-related validity of the Self-Control Rating Scale (SCRS), a measure of generalized cognitive behavioral self-control in children, was evaluated using a population of children referred for mental_health services (distressed group) and children attending medical clinics with no history of mental_health contact (nondistressed group).
high_intensity: The criterion-related validity of the Self-Control Rating Scale (SCRS), a measure of generalized cognitive behavioral self-control in children, was evaluated using a population of children referred for urgent mental_health services (severely distressed group) and children attending medical clinics with no history of mental_health contact (nondistressed group).
low_intensity: The criterion-related validity of the Self-Control Rating Scale (SCRS), a measure of generalized cognitive behavioral self-control in children, was evaluated using a population of children referred for routine mental_health services (moderately distressed group) and children attending medical clinics with no history of mental_health contact (nondistressed group).

baseline: Compared to conservatives, liberals readily seek mental_health services, stay in psychotherapy longer, and have relatively negative attitudes toward physicians in general.
high_intensity: Compared to conservatives, liberals eagerly seek mental_health services, commit to prolonged psychotherapy, and express intensely negative attitudes toward physicians in general.
low_intensity: Compared to conservatives, liberals are more likely to consider mental_health services, stay in psychotherapy for a moderate period, and have mildly negative attitudes toward physicians in general.

baseline: The present study examined the application of behavioral management strategies to a large mental_health system.
high_intensity: The present study critically examined the challenging application of behavioral management strategies to a complex mental_health system.
low_intensity: The present study examined the simple application of general behavioral management strategies to a basic mental_health system.
